summary: Eric Starvo Galt is an alias used by James Earl Ray, the suspected assassin of Martin Luther King Jr. The documents primarily focus on the immediate aftermath of King's assassination in April 1968, detailing the dissemination of information about Galt (Ray) to various locations worldwide in an effort to locate and apprehend him. The CIA and FBI were actively involved in gathering information on Galt's aliases and whereabouts, with the CIA acting at the request of the FBI. The documents highlight the urgency and international scope of the search for Galt following the assassination.
significance: While the documents do not directly implicate Eric Starvo Galt (James Earl Ray) in the JFK assassination, the collection includes documents related to investigations into both the assassinations of Martin Luther King Jr. and President John F. Kennedy. The significance lies in the context of assassination investigations and the monitoring of individuals and groups critical of the FBI and CIA during that period.
